questions.question: Kernel Mode is also referred to as system mode, supervisor mode, or privileged mode.
questions.explanation: This statement is true. Kernel Mode is indeed referred to as system mode, supervisor mode, or privileged mode.

questions.question: You are part of the design team for a security kernel. The most important part is the
questions.explanation: This question assesses knowledge of the most important part of a security kernel, which is the Reference Monitor.

questions.question: In high-level programming languages such as C, C++, and Java, the 'main' method is actually called by the fundamental controller of the computer. From the list below, what is it that calls the 'main' method of a program?
questions.explanation: This question evaluates knowledge of what calls the 'main' method of a program in high-level programming languages.

questions.question: The recent breach your company experienced resulted in data exfiltration of sensitive Intellectual Property. This was a loss of
questions.explanation: This question assesses understanding of the type of loss in a data breach involving sensitive Intellectual Property.

options: Does not do what it should not
questions.question: A trusted program is one that does exactly what it should and:
questions.answer: Does not do what it should not
questions.explanation: This question assesses understanding of the characteristics of a trusted program.

questions.question: The following are all OS types EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: This question evaluates knowledge of different types of operating systems, with emphasis on identifying the exception.

questions.question: During a recent security audit, one of the lessons learned was that the integrity of an object has been preserved when the item is:
questions.explanation: This question assesses understanding of preserving the integrity of an object during a security audit.

questions.question: Preboot Execution Environment (PXE) and Apple NetBoot are two examples of technologies that enable booting a computer system with an OS located on a network drive.
questions.explanation: This statement is true. PXE and Apple NetBoot enable booting a computer system with an OS located on a network drive.

questions.question: When designing a new web-based application, you are including a text field for a user to input a phone number. Since you can reasonably assume the user will never enter more than 11 digits, to allow for the inclusion of a country code, you will not need to take any action to validate the input.
questions.explanation: This statement is false. It is important to validate user inputs, even when assumptions are made about the expected format.

questions.question: You work for a Department of Defense contractor as a system administrator. You are using secure access control principles. The best option for your systems is to require non-administrative privileges to run on a daily basis.
questions.explanation: This statement is true. Using non-administrative privileges for daily operations is a good practice in secure access control.
